Models¶

class test_cedar_app.models.ast_method(id, method)¶
Parameters

  • id (AutoField) – ID

  • method (CharField) – Laboratory test method used to determine antimicrobial susceptibility

class test_cedar_app.models.atc_vet(*args, **kwargs)¶

A list of antimicrobials, taken from the ATCvet index.

Parameters

  • id (AutoField) – ID

  • levelname_1 (CharField) – The anatomical group to which the preparation belongs.

  • levelname_2 (CharField) – The therapeutic main group to which the preparation belongs.

  • levelname_3 (CharField) – The chemical/therapeutic/pharmacological subgroup (top-level) to which the preparation belongs.

  • levelname_4 (CharField) – The chemical/therapeutic/pharmacological subgroup (bottom-level) to which the preparation belongs.

  • levelname_4_coarse (CharField) – A coarser classification at the fourth level (chemical/therapeutic/pharmacological subgroup) to simplify record retrieval.

  • levelname_5 (CharField) – The chemical substance in the preparation.

  • levelname_5_alt (CharField) – An alternative name(s) for the preparation (e.g. USAN, BAN, ubiquitous priprietary name).

  • levelname_5_comb_example (CharField) – An example of a specific combination-preparation representative of the generic combination represented in the ATCvet.

  • levelcode_1 (CharField) – The portion of the ATCvet code that describes the preparation’s anatomical group.

  • levelcode_2 (CharField) – The portion of the ATCvet code that describes the preparation’s therapeutic main group.

  • levelcode_3 (CharField) – The portion of the ATCvet code that describes the preparation’s top-level therapeutic subgroup.

  • levelcode_4 (CharField) – The portion of the ATCvet code that describes the preparation’s bottom-level therapeutic subgroup.

  • levelcode_5 (CharField) – The ATCvet code that describes the preparation.

  • is_added (BooleanField) – The preparation/gene was added by the CEDAR team, and is not reflected in the published ATCvet index.

  • is_gene (BooleanField) – The preparation/gene is a gene.

  • aro_number (IntegerField) – The preparation/gene’s ARO number (from CARD).

  • is_duplicate (BooleanField) – There is another ATCvet code which include the same preparation(s). Use the alternate ATCvet code.

class test_cedar_app.models.factor(*args, **kwargs)¶

An individual factor associated with antimicrobial resistance.

Parameters

  • id (AutoField) – ID

  • factor_ref_id_id (ForeignKey) – The reference that describes the factor

  • resistance_id_id (ForeignKey) – The resistance that was assayed

  • factor_title (CharField) – A title that describes the factor, in title case. The title should be simple and direct, with no experimental context. The goal is to be able to understand what the factor is, while leaving the name as generic as possible; comparable factors from different studies should be easily indentifiable as comparable. Common abbreviations are acceptable. Factors including antimicrobial use should be formatted as “AntiX Use” where AntiX is the antimicrobial(s) administered (e.g. Bambermycin Use, Ceftiofur Use). Factors comparing organic / no antimicrobial use / free-range / conventional production should be titled “Production Type”, and a precise description provided in the description field

  • factor_description (TextField) – A brief description of the factor, in sentence case. Additional information and experimental conditions related to the factor are included here. This includes details such as level of antimicrobial use (dosage), serovar, time period of administration, prior antimicrobial use, etc. The description field can be left blank where there is no detail to be added beyond the title.

  • place_in_text (CharField) – The location of the factor data in-text, i.e. “Table 2”. If the data is from the body of the text, use the page and paragraph numbers (Pg. and Para. respectively)

  • host_01_id_id (ForeignKey) – The ID of the parent host

  • host_02_id_id (ForeignKey) – The host subtype from which the microbe was isolated

  • microbe_01_id_id (ForeignKey) – The ID of the parent microbe

  • microbe_02_id_id (ForeignKey) – The subtype of the microbe assayed for resistance

  • prod_stage_group_allocate_id_id (ForeignKey) – The production stage at which the groups were allocated (i.e. factor applied)

  • prod_stage_group_observe_id_id (ForeignKey) – The production stage at which the observations were recorded (i.e. factor observed)

  • group_exposed (CharField) – A brief description of the exposed group, in title case. The description should again, be simple and direct. Comparison groups are allocated as described in the literature. If no allocation is provided, the less interventionist (or default practice) should be used as the referent. Factors including antimicrobial use are always given with the less interventionist as the referent (i.e. with “No Use” as the referent group or the lower dose as the referent, and “AntiX Use” for the exposed group, where AntiX is the antimicrobial(s) administered). The dose should be provided in the main factor description, unless the factor is a comparison of two doses

  • group_referent (CharField) – A brief description of the referent (unexposed) group, in title case. The description should again, be simple and direct. Comparison groups are allocated as described in the literature. If no allocation is provided, the less interventionist (or default practice) should be used as the referent. Factors including antimicrobial use are always given with the less interventionist as the referent (i.e. with “No Use” as the referent group or the lower dose as the referent, and “AntiX Use” for the exposed group, where AntiX is the antimicrobial(s) administered). The dose should be provided in the main factor description, unless the factor is a comparison of two doses

  • moa_type_id_id (ForeignKey) – The type of measure of association reported for the factor

  • moa_unit_id_id (ForeignKey) – The experimental unit or level of analysis for which the measure of association is presented

  • contable_a (PositiveIntegerField) – The number of observations of resistance in the exposed group

  • contable_b (PositiveIntegerField) – The number of observations of susceptibility in the exposed group

  • contable_c (PositiveIntegerField) – The number of observations of resistance in the referent group

  • contable_d (PositiveIntegerField) – The number of observations of susceptibility in the referent group

  • prevtable_a (DecimalField) – The proportion of observations of resistance in the exposed group, up to 2 decimal places

  • prevtable_b (DecimalField) – The proportion of observations of susceptibility in the exposed group, up to 2 decimal places

  • prevtable_c (DecimalField) – The proportion of observations of resistance in the referent group, up to 2 decimal places

  • prevtable_d (DecimalField) – The proportion of observations of susceptibility in the referent group, up to 2 decimal places

  • table_n_exp (PositiveIntegerField) – The total number of observations in the exposed group

  • table_n_ref (PositiveIntegerField) – The total number of observations in the referent group

  • odds_ratio (DecimalField) – The odds ratio that describes the factor, up to 2 decimal places

  • odds_ratio_lo (DecimalField) – The lower (usually 95%) confidence interval of the odds ratio that describes the factor, up to 2 decimal places

  • odds_ratio_up (DecimalField) – The upper (usually 95%) confidence interval of the odds ratio that describes the factor, up to 2 decimal places

  • odds_ratio_sig (CharField) – The significance (p-value) associated with the odds ratio that describes the factor, i.e. “< 0.05”. May include symbols, numbers, and letters. There is no significance associated with count or prevalence data, only Odds Ratios. If an odds ratio is provided, without a significance level, please report “NR” for “not reported”

  • odds_ratio_confidence (DecimalField) – The level pertaining to the lower and upper confidence intervals (i.e. 95%)

  • DEP_total_obs (CharField) – DEP total obs

  • DEP_exclude_iam (BooleanField) – DEP exclude iam

  • DEP_exclude_iam_reason (CharField) – DEP exclude iam reason

  • OLD_short_name (CharField) – OLD short name

  • OLD_resistance_id (IntegerField) – OLD resistance id

  • OLD_use_id (IntegerField) – OLD use id

  • microbe_02_old_id (IntegerField) – microbe 02 old id

  • TEMP_use_id (IntegerField) – TEMP use id

  • exclude_cedar (BooleanField) – exclude cedar

  • exclude_cedar_reason (CharField) – exclude cedar reason

  • factor_v0_id (IntegerField) – The factor ID from v0 of CEDAR (CEDAR 2016), often used in model identifiers prior to 2020.

  • v12_is_v1_import (BooleanField) – The factor is imported from v1.

  • v12_ID_factor_v1 (IntegerField) – The factor ID used within CEDAR v1.

  • v12_ID_reference_v1 (IntegerField) – The reference ID to which the factor belonged in v1.

  • v12_ID_reference_v2_initial (IntegerField) – The reference ID assigned during import of v1 to v2, prior to reassignment of duplicates.

  • v12_solo_extraction_2016 (BooleanField) – The factor was replaced (sole source).

clean()¶

Hook for doing any extra model-wide validation after clean() has been called on every field by self.clean_fields. Any ValidationError raised by this method will not be associated with a particular field; it will have a special-case association with the field defined by NON_FIELD_ERRORS.

class test_cedar_app.models.factor_exclusion(*args, **kwargs)¶

A factor that is to be excluded from an iAM.AMR model.

Parameters

  • factor_id_id (ForeignKey) – The factor that is to be excluded

  • model_id_id (ForeignKey) – The model from which the factor should be excluded

  • exclude_reason (TextField) – exclude reason

Parameters

  • host_subtype_name (CharField) – The host subtype from which the assayed microbe originated, i.e. “Eggs” for a parent host “Chicken”

  • DEP_sel_beef (BooleanField) – DEP sel beef

  • DEP_sel_broil (BooleanField) – DEP sel broil

class test_cedar_app.models.location_01(*args, **kwargs)¶

A location (a country).

Parameters

  • id (AutoField) – ID

  • country_area (TextField) – Country name

  • iso_country_code_3 (CharField) – ISO country code (3 characters)

  • iso_country_code_2 (CharField) – ISO country code (2 characters)

  • iso_country_code_1 (IntegerField) – ISO country code (numerical)

  • m49_code (IntegerField) – M49 code

  • code_global (IntegerField) – Global code

  • name_global (TextField) – Global name

  • code_region (IntegerField) – Region code

  • name_region (CharField) – Region name

  • code_subregion (IntegerField) – Subregion code

  • name_subregion (CharField) – Subregion name

  • code_intermediate_subregion (IntegerField) – Intermediate subregion code

  • name_intermediate_subregion (CharField) – Intermediate subregion name

  • bin_least_developed_countries (BooleanField) – bin least developed countries

  • bin_land_lock_least_developed_countries (BooleanField) – bin land lock least developed countries

  • bin_small_island_developing_states (BooleanField) – bin small island developing states

  • bin_developing (BooleanField) – bin developing

class test_cedar_app.models.location_02(*args, **kwargs)¶

A location (a subdivision below a country, i.e. a state, province, parish, etc.)

Parameters

  • id (AutoField) – ID

  • iso_country_code_2_id_id (ForeignKey) – The ISO 3166 alpha-2 country code, i.e. “CA” for Canada

  • subdivision_code (CharField) – The subdivision code specified by the iso_3166_2 code. Normally two or three letters (i.e. “ON” for Ontario), but the numerals 2-9 may also be used

  • subdivision (CharField) – The name of the subdivision, i.e. “Ontario”

  • subdivision_type (CharField) – The type of subdivision within the country, i.e. “Province”

  • cipars_region_national (BooleanField) – The location is within the CIPARS national region

  • cipars_region_atlantic (BooleanField) – The location is within the CIPARS atlantic region

  • cipars_region_maritimes (BooleanField) – The location is within the CIPARS maritimes region

  • cipars_region_prairies (BooleanField) – The location is within the CIPARS prairies region

class test_cedar_app.models.location_join(id, loc_ref_id, location_01_id, location_02_id, ref_loc_note)¶
Parameters

  • id (AutoField) – ID

  • loc_ref_id_id (ForeignKey) – The reference pertaining to this location

  • location_01_id_id (ForeignKey) – location 01 id

  • location_02_id_id (ForeignKey) – location 02 id

  • ref_loc_note (TextField) – A free-text description of the subdivision, allowing users to specify custom subdivisions like “east”, “Mid-atlantic region” or “Nationwide”

class test_cedar_app.models.model(*args, **kwargs)¶

An iAM.AMR model for which a query may be generated.

Parameters

  • id (AutoField) – ID

  • model_name (CharField) – The name of the iAM.AMR model, i.e. “iAM.AMR.CHI”

  • model_description (CharField) – A simple and brief description or ‘caption’ of the model

  • model_create_user_id_id (ForeignKey) – The user who created the model/query

  • model_create_date (DateField) – The date the model/query was created, in YYYY-MM-DD format

  • model_maintain_date (DateField) – The date the model/query was last updated, in YYYY-MM-DD format

class test_cedar_app.models.production_stage(*args, **kwargs)¶

A production stage along the farm-to-fork continuum.

Parameters

  • id (AutoField) – ID

  • stage (CharField) – The production stage to which the factor applies, or where the effect of a factor is observed, i.e. “Farm”

class test_cedar_app.models.publisher(*args, **kwargs)¶

A publishing organization pertaining to one or more references/studies.

Parameters

  • id (AutoField) – ID

  • pub_type (CharField) – The type of publication, i.e. “Journal”

  • pub_title (TextField) – The title of the publication, i.e. “Nature Reviews Immunology”

  • pub_rank (IntegerField) – The Scimago rank at the time of import (2018)

  • pub_issn (TextField) – The ISSN of the publication, i.e. “15424863, 00079235”

class test_cedar_app.models.reference(*args, **kwargs)¶

A reference/article/study from which factors are extracted.

Parameters

  • id (AutoField) – ID

  • other_reference_id (PositiveIntegerField) – An additional identifier for the study, from the legacy database

  • key_bibtex (CharField) – An abbreviated identifier for the study in the format of an in-text citation, given by Bibtex, i.e. “Jones2013”. A lowercase letter is appended to the date where multiple items may be confused.

  • refwk (PositiveIntegerField) – The corresponding RefWorks ID for the study

  • study_authors (TextField) – The name(s) or surname(s) of the authors, in the form of a comma-separated or semi-colon-separated list, i.e. “Chapman, Smith, Otten, Fazil” or “Howe, K.; Linton, A. H.; Osborne, A. D.”

  • publish_id_id (ForeignKey) – The outlet which published the study

  • publish_name_alt (CharField) – The name of the publisher as provided in the source material, if different than the publisher indicated by publish_id.

  • publish_year (CharField) – The year in which the study was published

  • publish_doi (CharField) – The DOI associated with the reference, i.e. 10.3168/jds.2014-8432

  • publish_pmid (CharField) – The eight-digit PMID associated with the reference, i.e. 84889799

  • study_title (TextField) – The title of the study, in sentence case

  • study_design_id_id (ForeignKey) – The type of study design used in the study

  • study_design_detail (TextField) – The details of the study design. Often, this can be copied from the study directly

  • study_sample_method (TextField) – A description of the sampling method (i.e. how samples were selected and collected) used in the study

  • ref_has_explicit_break (CharField) – Specifies whether the study explicitly reports the MIC values used in its susceptibility tests

  • ref_has_mic_table (CharField) – Specifies whether the study includes an MIC table

  • capture_search_2016 (BooleanField) – The reference was captured in the 2016 literature search

  • capture_search_2019 (BooleanField) – The reference was captured in the 2019 literature search

  • capture_snowball (BooleanField) – The reference was captured through snowballing (searching cited papers, and or reverse citations)

  • capture_submit (BooleanField) – The reference was captured through a direct submission to CEDAR

  • ast_method_id_id (ForeignKey) – The antimicrobial susceptibility test type applied in the study

  • DEP_study_objective (TextField) – DEP study objective

  • exclude_extraction (BooleanField) – Specifies whether or not to exclude the reference from extraction

  • exclude_extraction_reason (CharField) – If the reference is to be excluded, the reason for doing so

  • v12_v1_id (BooleanField) – The record was imported from CEDAR_v1 into CEDAR_v2.

  • v12_is_in_v1_and_v2 (BooleanField) – This reference exists in both v1 and v2.

  • v12_reference_ID_in_v1 (PositiveIntegerField) – The reference ID used within CEDAR v1. This only exists when the reference is an import from v1.

  • v12_migrated_from (PositiveIntegerField) – For v2 references, this is the v1 reference which matched during factor migration from v1 to v2. Factors were migrated from this record.

  • v12_migrated_to (PositiveIntegerField) – For v1 references, this is the v2 reference which matched during factor migration from v1 to v2. Factors were migrated to this record.

  • v12_solo_extraction_2016 (BooleanField) – The factor was replaced (sole source).

  • ref_abstract (TextField) – ref abstract

  • CEDAR_extract_east (BooleanField) – Specifies whether this reference is to be extracted by the “east” team (i.e. Guelph/ON)

  • CEDAR_extract_west (BooleanField) – Specifies whether this reference is to be extracted by the “west” team (i.e. Alberta)

  • CEDAR_extract_esr (BooleanField) – Specifies whether this reference is to be extracted by the ESR team (i.e. “Entercoccus Scoping Review”)

  • topic_tab_cattle (BooleanField) – The title or abstract of this reference contains keywords related to this topic (animal, or microbe).

  • topic_tab_chicken (BooleanField) – The title or abstract of this reference contains keywords related to this topic (animal, or microbe).

  • topic_tab_swine (BooleanField) – The title or abstract of this reference contains keywords related to this topic (animal, or microbe).

  • topic_tab_turkey (BooleanField) – The title or abstract of this reference contains keywords related to this topic (animal, or microbe).

  • topic_tab_ecoli (BooleanField) – The title or abstract of this reference contains keywords related to this topic (animal, or microbe).

  • topic_tab_enterococcus (BooleanField) – The title or abstract of this reference contains keywords related to this topic (animal, or microbe).

  • topic_tab_salmonella (BooleanField) – The title or abstract of this reference contains keywords related to this topic (animal, or microbe).

  • topic_tab_campylobacter (BooleanField) – The title or abstract of this reference contains keywords related to this topic (animal, or microbe).

  • topic_tab_has_topic (BooleanField) – Specifies whether the reference mentions at least one specific host or microbe

  • topic_tab_host_free (CharField) – Free text description of the animal host(s) the reference pertains to

  • topic_tab_microbe_free (CharField) – Free text description of the microbe(s) the reference pertains to

  • archived (BooleanField) – archived

  • archived_why (CharField) – archived why

  • DEP_other_genomics (CharField) – DEP other genomics

  • DEP_analysis_unit_id (IntegerField) – DEP analysis unit id

  • DEP_ref_has_mdr (CharField) – DEP ref has mdr

  • OLD_status_id (IntegerField) – OLD status id

  • OLD_ref_has_wgs (CharField) – OLD ref has wgs

  • OLD_pub_name (IntegerField) – OLD pub name

  • OLD_id (IntegerField) – OLD id

  • OLD_subdivision (CharField) – OLD subdivision

  • OLD_country_id (IntegerField) – OLD country id

  • OLD_has_plasmid_type (BooleanField) – OLD has plasmid type

  • ast_free (CharField) – ast free

  • ref_has_data_pheno_level (CharField) – ref has data pheno level

  • ref_has_data_geno_level (CharField) – ref has data geno level

  • ref_has_esbl_factor (CharField) – ref has esbl factor

class test_cedar_app.models.reference_note(*args, **kwargs)¶

A note written for a particular reference.

Parameters

  • id (AutoField) – ID

  • note_ref_id_id (ForeignKey) – The reference pertaining to this note

  • note (TextField) – A free-text note describing any challenges with interpreting the study, or extracting the data

  • user_id_id (ForeignKey) – The user who made the note

  • resolved (BooleanField) – Specifies whether or not the note was resolved or addressed

  • design (CharField) – The overall study design of the study
